function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Studies with high risk of bias or low quality not excluded from sensitivity analysis","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unclear definition of terms such as \\\\u2019neighbourhood environment\\\\u2019 and \\\\u2019built environment\\\\u2019 may lead to inconsistent inclusion or exclusion of studies related to contagious diseases.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate piloting of data extraction sheet may result in incomplete or inaccurate recording of study details, leading to potential data errors and bias in the synthesis and analysis.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Publication bias or selective reporting in meta-analysis may lead to an inaccurate estimation of the association between greenspace and contagious diseases in the built environment.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exclusion of communicable diseases from the review may overlook the impact of greenspace on disease transmission and propagation.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Exclusion of mental health from the review may neglect the potential mental health benefits of greenspace, impacting overall well-being and quality of life.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited scope may result in overlooking the impact of greenspace on certain health outcomes, leading to incomplete evidence for decision-making.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential transmission of contagious diseases through contact with nature and outdoor environments.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential for spread of contagious diseases in congested greenspaces","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate management of waste and sanitation in greenspaces","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of awareness and education on disease prevention in greenspaces","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Low-income neighborhoods have reduced greenspace availability, leading to lower use of greenspaces","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Park quality and frequency of park use are higher among high-socioeconomic status ses residents","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Living in a greener neighborhood is linked with stronger greenspace-health associations and lower income-related health inequalities","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Decreased access to greenspaces in urban areas","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of collaboration between health care providers and local nature partnerships","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Rapid spread of contagious diseases in densely populated areas such as metropolitan contexts and sub-regional realities with widespread urbanization.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty and temporary interventions in the housing sector due to the pandemic, leading to potential disruptions in the sharing economy and real estate market.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of support for digital transformation processes","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate integration of spatially blind policies and local ones","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of integration between real estate interests and social value in urban regeneration processes","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of healthcare trace and tracking in epidemiological management.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of proximity economies and place-based perspective in economic development policies.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of innovation in public policies for reusing and sharing commercial spaces.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Proximity-based placemaking approach may lead to close contact and potential spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of hygiene and sanitation practices in public spaces","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Close proximity and interaction in public spaces","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of guidance and planning in placemaking initiatives","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Members joining the cooperative voluntarily may introduce contagious diseases into the company\\u2019s environment.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Operation of a research laboratory, store, and food/agriculture laboratory may create environments conducive to disease transmission if proper health and safety measures are not observed.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reshaping the spatial dimension of neighborhoods and proximity economies may lead to increased population density and inadequate infrastructure for disease control.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of coordinated innovation in territorial development may hinder progress in local productivity structures.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate promotion of alternative technologies with low environmental impact may lead to unsustainable development practices.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of feasibility studies and planning for the implementation of innovative projects may result in ineffective and unsustainable outcomes.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Installation and maintenance of photovoltaic panels on public and private buildings may pose a risk of physical accidents or falls during the construction and upkeep of the systems.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Multi-utility structure including distribution and supply of fuel gases and water resources increases the risk of contamination and waterborne diseases if not managed properly.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of profits for urban regeneration interventions may lead to unintended consequences such as displacing vulnerable communities or disrupting natural habitats, potentially affecting the well-being of the population.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Proximity-based entrepreneurial innovations may lead to increased interaction and exposure among individuals, potentially contributing to the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Community-based organizations and energy policies may involve physical gatherings and interactions, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The creation of energy communities and collective energy projects may lead to increased physical interaction and social gatherings, posing a risk for disease transmission.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of privacy protection for individuals\\u2019 purchasing and movement data","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases through crowded retail spaces and transport hubs","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of economic instability and disparity in neighborhoods due to post-pandemic contractions","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insufficient investment capacity for digital visibility","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Liquidity crisis due to pandemic","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of skills and tools for local market analysis","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The emerging growth of mobile commerce and e-commerce may lead to an increase in physical interaction and foot traffic in retail spaces, leading to a higher risk of contagious disease transmission.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The use of new customer-adapted delivery and collection services may involve direct interaction between delivery personnel and consumers, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The presence of various modalities of interaction with consumers, including in-person engagement methods, increases the risk of disease transmission in retail and neighborhood services.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Proximity economy-based urban agenda may lead to increased proximity and contact between individuals, increasing the risk of contagious disease transmission.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"}]}
